raw: * This is the base class for all mobile widgets.
* @use(qx.ui.mobile.core.EventHandler)
* @require(qx.bom.Lifecycle)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is the base class for all mobile widgets.

raw: * Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen (after pointerdown till pointerup).

@description.body: Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen (after pointerdown till pointerup).

raw: * This event if fired if a keyboard key is released.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event if fired if a keyboard key is released.

raw: * This event if fired if a keyboard key is pressed down. This event is
* only fired once if the user keeps the key pressed for a while.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event if fired if a keyboard key is pressed down. This event is only fired once if the user keeps the key pressed for a while.

raw: * This event is fired any time a key is pressed. It will be repeated if
* the user keeps the key pressed. The pressed key can be determined using
* {@link qx.event.type.KeySequence#getKeyIdentifier}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired any time a key is pressed. It will be repeated if the user keeps the key pressed. The pressed key can be determined using {@link qx.event.type.KeySequence#getKeyIdentifier}.

raw: * This event is fired if the pressed key or keys result in a printable
* character. Since the character is not necessarily associated with a
* single physical key press, the event does not have a key identifier
* getter. This event gets repeated if the user keeps pressing the key(s).
* The unicode code of the pressed key can be read using
* {@link qx.event.type.KeyInput#getCharCode}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired if the pressed key or keys result in a printable character. Since the character is not necessarily associated with a single physical key press, the event does not have a key identifier getter. This event gets repeated if the user keeps pressing the key(s). The unicode code of the pressed key can be read using {@link qx.event.type.KeyInput#getCharCode}.

raw: * Fired after a massive DOM manipulation, e.g. when DOM elements were
* added or styles were changed. Listen to this event, if you need to
* recalculate a layout or have to update your view.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired after a massive DOM manipulation, e.g. when DOM elements were added or styles were changed. Listen to this event, if you need to recalculate a layout or have to update your view.

raw: * The default CSS class used for this widget. The default CSS class
* should contain the common appearance of the widget.
* It is set to the container element of the widget. Use {@link #addCssClass}
* to enhance the default appearance of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The default CSS class used for this widget. The default CSS class should contain the common appearance of the widget. It is set to the container element of the widget. Use {@link #addCssClass} to enhance the default appearance of the widget.

raw: * Whether this widget is enabled or not

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether this widget is enabled or not

* an element by its name attribute.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The name attribute of the container element. Useful when you want to find an element by its name attribute.

raw: * Whether the widget should be the target of an event. Set this property
* to false when the widget is a child of another widget and
* shouldn't react on events.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should be the target of an event. Set this property to false when the widget is a child of another widget and shouldn't react on events.

raw: * The ID of the widget. When the ID is set to null an auto
* id will be generated.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The ID of the widget. When the ID is set to null an auto id will be generated.

raw: * Controls the visibility. Valid values are:
* <ul>

*
  • visible: Render the widget

*
  • hidden: Hide the widget. The space will be still available.

*
  • excluded: Hide the widget. The space will be released.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Controls the visibility. Valid values are:

  • visible: Render the widget
  • hidden: Hide the widget. The space will be still available.
  • excluded: Hide the widget. The space will be released.

raw: * Whether the widget can be activated or not. When the widget is activated
* a css class active is automatically added to the widget, which
* can indicate the activation status.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget can be activated or not. When the widget is activated a css class active is automatically added to the widget, which can indicate the activation status.

raw: * Rotates the widget. Negative and positive values are allowed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Rotates the widget. Negative and positive values are allowed.

raw: * This property controls whether the transformation uses the length unit px or rem.
* This feature is important for creating a resolution independent transformation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This property controls whether the transformation uses the length unit px or rem. This feature is important for creating a resolution independent transformation.

raw: * Schedules the {@link #domUpdated} method. The method will be called after a timeout
* to prevent the triggered events to be fired too often, during massive DOM manipulations.
* @internal

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Schedules the {@link #domUpdated} method. The method will be called after a timeout to prevent the triggered events to be fired too often, during massive DOM manipulations.

raw: * Fires the DOM updated event directly. Triggers the {@link qx.event.handler.Appear#refresh} and
* {@link qx.ui.mobile.core.DomUpdatedHandler#refresh} methods. Do not use this
* method during massive DOM manipulations. Use {@link #scheduleDomUpdated} instead.
* @internal

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires the DOM updated event directly. Triggers the {@link qx.event.handler.Appear#refresh} and {@link qx.ui.mobile.core.DomUpdatedHandler#refresh} methods. Do not use this method during massive DOM manipulations. Use {@link #scheduleDomUpdated} instead.

raw: * Adds an attribute mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyAttribute}
* method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real
* attribute name. Use this method if you want to add an attribute entry to the mapping
* from the defer function of a different widget.
* "selectable" :
*   attribute : "data-selectable",
*   values :
*     "true" : null,
*     "false" : "false"
* @param property {String} The property name
* @param attribute {String} The real attribute name
* @param values {Map} Values of the property to the real attribute value.
*      Use null, when you want not to set the attribute.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an attribute mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyAttribute} method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real attribute name. Use this method if you want to add an attribute entry to the mapping from the defer function of a different widget. e.g.: "selectable" : { attribute : "data-selectable", values : { "true" : null, "false" : "false" } }

@param.name: @param
@param.body: property {String} The property name
@param.description: The property name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: attribute {String} The real attribute name
@param.description: The real attribute name

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
values {Map} Values of the property to the real attribute value.
      Use null, when you want not to set the attribute.
@param.description:
Values of the property to the real attribute value.
      Use null, when you want not to set the attribute.

raw: * Adds a style mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyStyle}
* method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real
* style name. Use this method if you want to add a style entry to the mapping
* from the defer function of a different widget.
* "anonymous" :
*  style : "pointer-events",
*  values :
*    "true" : "none",
*    "false" : null
* @param property {String} The property name
* @param style {String} The real style name
* @param values {Map} Values of the property to the real style value.
*      Use null, when you want not to set the style.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a style mapping entry. This entry is used by the {@link #_applyStyle} method. Shortcut when the property name differs from the real style name. Use this method if you want to add a style entry to the mapping from the defer function of a different widget. e.g.: "anonymous" : { style : "pointer-events", values : { "true" : "none", "false" : null } }

@param.name: @param
@param.body: property {String} The property name
@param.description: The property name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: style {String} The real style name
@param.description: The real style name

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
values {Map} Values of the property to the real style value.
      Use null, when you want not to set the style.
@param.description:
Values of the property to the real style value.
      Use null, when you want not to set the style.

raw: * Returns the content DOM element of the widget.
* Override this method, to define another element as the content element.
* Note: Most times this element points to to the container element.
* When the widget has a more complex element structure,
* the function should return a reference of the element that should contain
* the content.
* @return {Element} the content DOM element of the widget

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the content DOM element of the widget. Override this method, to define another element as the content element. Note: Most times this element points to to the container element. When the widget has a more complex element structure, the function should return a reference of the element that should contain the content.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} the content DOM element of the widget
@return.description: the content DOM element of the widget

raw: * Translate a message
* Mark the message for translation.
* @param messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
* @param varargs {Object?} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
* @return {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a message Mark the message for translation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object?} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

raw: * Translate a plural message
* Mark the messages for translation.
* Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.
* @param singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
* @param pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
* @param count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
* @param varargs {Object?} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
* @return {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a plural message Mark the messages for translation. Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object?} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string
